title: Living Lab
blurb: McGill's Living Lab : A database of sustainability-focused Applied Student Research (ASR) projects,The Living Lab is a digital repository of applied research that creates a culture of sustainability on McGill campus. The database aims to help McGill and the broader community visibility, learn from, and build upon sustainability-focused projects.
rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

title: Theses & Dissertations
blurb: Contains all theses and dissertations completed at McGill.

title: Research Publications
blurb: Faculty publications include articles, conference papers, books and working papers by members of the McGill academic community.

title: Projects for Course-Based Graduate Degrees
blurb: Research projects and papers coming from a course-based graduate degrees. Includes works from departments such as the Department of Integrated Studies in Education (DISE), Educational and Counselling Psychology, School of Architecture, School of Computer Science, School of Social Work, School of Urban Planning, and the Schulich School of Music.

title: Undergraduate Research
blurb: Undergraduate research contains undergraduate Bioresource Engineering project reports, Honours theses, and Faculty-sponsored papers. Honours undergraduate theses may be included in eScholarship if sponsored by a faculty member. Faculty-sponsored papers are exemplary examples of undergraduate scholarship. Faculty members wishing to sponsor an honours thesis or a paper for deposit should contact escholarship.library@mcgill.ca
rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
